data.name: AccommAirBnBDetails
data.value: Stay like a local and if cost is a concern, maybe other guest would split on a larger place.

data.name: AccommBookingDetails
data.value: London has hundreds if not thousands of hotels to chose from, shop around as there are often some pretty good deals.

data.name: AccommGrangeDetails
data.value: Less than 10mins walk from St. Ermin's, The Grange Wellington Hotel offers some competitively priced rooms

data.name: AccommParkPlazaDetails
data.value: Conveniently located near St. Ermins' Hotel and if you don't mind splashing out a bit more.

data.name: AccommStErminsDetails
data.value: Mention our names when making your reservation to receive the group booking discount.

data.name: AccommZHotelDetails
data.value: Also conveniently located near St. Ermin's Hotel. The Z Hotel has some reasonable rooms for a reasonable price..

data.name: OurStoryDetails
data.value: A little story of our relationship

data.name: OurStoryHowHeProposedDetails2
data.value: Chris took me for a "surprise" trip to Florence in Italy. He booked a fantastic hotel in the largest private gardens in Europe. One day after breakfast, we both decided to go to the gardens in order to take a few pictures for a nice memory…and then it happened with nervous and uncertain "Will you?". My first answer was "I hope you realise that this is a commitment for the rest of your life" leaving a little break to follow "Yes, I will marry you".

data.name: OurStoryHowWeMetDetails2
data.value: Considering the current worldwide trend that is promising to match you with "The One" through all the on-line and mobile phone apps, we met in the office to be said in a real life. Lenka was already working in the company before I joined. I came for an interview when I noticed a pretty blond in a red dress "mmm"...

data.name: OurStoryNewChapterDetails1
data.value: And here we are… planning our special day that opens a new chapter in our lives as Mr. & Mrs. surrounded by the dearest and closest family and friends. We are extremely excited you can be there and celebrate this joyful & emotional day with us.

data.name: OurStoryOurFirstDateDetails2
data.value: Our first date "was" very romantic. Chris invited me for after work drinks where only Chris turned up. Suspicious? Surprise?! :) Anyways, we went to a local traditional neighbourhood boozer called "The Flying Horse" where the time flown during interesting conversations so that I missed the last tube that could get me home. Hence Chris suggested to give me a lift on his Vespa motorcycle with "L" (Learner) sign at the back taking me through the side narrow streets avoiding police officers. That is certainly quite a memory :)

data.name: OurStoryOurFirstHolidayDetails1
data.value: The sky lit up and danced

data.name: OurStoryOurFirstHolidayDetails2
data.value: Our first holiday was also a celebration of Lenka’s birthday. The rugged and absolutely beautiful scenery of Iceland was to be scratched off our bucket lists. From the warmth of the Blue Lagoon to the Aurora Borealis starting just as we arrive, in what can only be described as the middle of nowhere in the dead of night, as if it was almost a show just for the two of us to the freezing cold and trembling hands whilst trying to capture a picture of the Geysers and frozen waterfalls. It truly was a first of many unforgettable adventures.

data.name: RegistryDetails
data.value: We understand that many of you have to travel, take time off and generally have extra expenses in order to celebrate our wedding day with us. However, if you are still considering to get us something as a wedding gift, we would welcome any contributions towards our honeymoon fund to create new memories and unforgettable adventures.

data.name: RsvpDetails1
data.value: Please let us know if you can make it by

data.value: Saturday August 26th, 2017 - Bucks & Hens details to follow.

data.name: WeddingDetails
data.value: Join Lenka & Chris on the 26th of August, 2017 to celebrate their union.

data.name: WeddingStErminsHotelDetails1
data.value: In 1887, St. Ermin’s opened as luxurious apartments, and in 1899, the structure was converted into a luxury hotel, soon to be prized among London’s visitors and residents alike upon its opening in 1905. Exquisite theatre designer J.P. Briggs crafted the meeting and event spaces in an opulent Victorian fashion, and modern conveniences arose at St. Ermin’s, when telephones were placed within guestrooms rather than the more traditional use of bells. A notable spot for important public figures, St. Ermin’s has frequently seen visits from politicians, celebrities, and members of Parliament.

data.name: WeddingStErminsHotelDetails2
data.value: In 1940 Winston Churchill, held a historic meeting at St. Ermin’s Hotel. He asked a group of remarkable people to join him in ‘Setting Europe Ablaze’ – this elite set, were to become the founding members of the SOE (Special Operations Executive). The unit carried out covert operations during WW2, from their headquarters – an entire floor of St. Ermin’s Hotel, whilst MI6 were stationed two floors above. SOE agents’ printed secret coded messages on pieces of silk, an original sample hangs in the Lobby, hunt it down and try to crack the code. In the 1950's the spy Guy Burgess (part of the infamous Cambridge five) handed over secret papers to his Russian counterpart in the Caxton Bar.

data.name: WeddingStErminsHotelDetails3
data.value: St. Ermin’s continues to play an important part in London’s history, as it is rumoured that a tunnel runs from underneath the grand staircase in the Lobby all the way to the houses of Westminster.

data.name: WeddingTimelineDetails
data.value: A little about what to expect on the day.
